programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear

Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: In a special 20th anniversary celebration for the programme, Tony Robinson relives the best bits from more than 200 episodes, taking in major highlights such as digging up the garden of Buckingham Palace to reveal a crashed Spitfire and discovering the first stone circle to be found in Britain for 150 years. There is a reminder of how the show grew from nervous beginnings in a Somerset field into attempting city-wide digs and promoting nationwide events in which thousands of people spent the weekend digging in their own backyards.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: War of the Roses: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson reports on the discovery of a Roman circus in Colchester, Essex, the only one known to have been built in Britain. Experts Phil Harding and Guy de la Bedoyere examine the artefacts found at the site, reveal the dangerous life of a charioteer and discover one of the most famous incidents in the town's history - when Emperor Claudius made a royal visit on the back of an elephant.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson traces the story of the warrior queen, following an excavation in Norfolk that may hold clues to what happened to her tribe, the Iceni, after its defeat at the hands of the Romans. The presenter visits Caistor St Edmund to investigate whether the Empire crushed Boudica's people or if she unwittingly led them to destruction.

programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. programme.desc: Tony Robinson follows the renovation of the Grange, a house in Ramsgate, Kent, formerly owned by 19th-century architect Augustus Pugin, co-creator of the Houses of Parliament. Pugin's designs for the home became a blueprint for thousands of properties built after his death and in 20 years he succeeded in changing the face of England. With the help of experts such as Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud, the Landmark Trust aims to restore a piece of history.

programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.desc: A bereaved couple hire Lovejoy to find a pair of Regency duelling pistols and bring about the downfall of a murderer - but to complete the task he is forced to risk Jane's life and fight a duel. Anthony Valentine guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is drawn into a serious family dispute by an American woman who believes her father murdered her mother and wants him deported back to Florida to stand trial. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim agrees to chauffeur Charlie to an 80th birthday party in France that turns out to be more eventful than he anticipated. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Crime author Jack Rudd visits Brokenwood to give a reading at the local book club - but he never leaves, falling victim to a method of murder portrayed in his own book.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a murder connected to vaudeville entertainers Harry and Al Jolson, while Watts unravels a mystery about his own family.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: Frankie suspects sabotage when a baseball player dies mid-game, but her investigation puts her at odds with ruthless mobster Bessie Starkman. Crime drama, starring Lauren Lee Smith.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: When Penny's (Hayley McElhinney) away on honeymoon Hugh (Rodger Corser) and Tara (Kate Jenkinson) come out to play, with a little help from Charlie (Nicole da Silva) their night takes a dramatic turn as Hugh loses more than his sobriety.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: April is pregnant, and not everyone is as supportive as Matt had hoped, but the netball game between the hospital and mining company takes all the focus.

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah leads the charge to rescue James, whose ordeal continues when his sexuality becomes known, and puts her relationship with George at risk when a disturbing discovery forces her to reveal her darkest secret.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah reveals her horrific secret to George, and their relationship is suddenly thrown into doubt. The Christmas soiree brings out Jack's intimacy issues, and Anna publicly humiliates Andrew. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers carry out a series of exercises in evacuating casualties from a combat zone, which leaves them convinced they are about to be sent on active duty.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gabriel once again steps outside the bounds of the law, unleashing his gang of thugs on two youths who have been tormenting an elderly lady, but the unexpected return of an old ally could mean his days as a vigilante are numbered. Meanwhile, Sam turns to a police profiler for help in tracking down the Sun Hill serial rapist, Sheelagh finds herself accused of racism, and a race to save two children from drowning has a profound effect on Honey and Cameron.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Already haunted by Kerry's rape, Cameron is plunged into further emotional torment after failing to save the two drowning children. Sam's hunt for the Sun Hill rapist is jeopardised by a witness's suicide attempt and alarm bells ring for Ken when he spies the matriarch of a notorious criminal clan thought to have been in exile abroad. Guest starring Lynda Bellingham.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Recovering alcoholic Jim finds himself battling an addiction of a different sort as he gets bitten by the gambling bug, and there's a big surprise in store for Phil.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry reveals a ruthless streak as she confronts Cameron over his liaison with Honey, then storms off for a showdown with Gabriel, determined to make him pay for raping her. PC Steve Hunter's debut at Sun Hill gets off to a bad start when he antagonises his brother Phil, and tragedy strikes as June is run over by Tony when he pursues the driver of a stolen vehicle.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Cheryl and Dick welcome their adopted son Oscar home for the first time, and Peggy and Lucy fight for their lives after a runaway horse causes a horrific road accident.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A glamorous blonde turns up in Skelthwaite to see an old friend, only to find the town in mourning for Peggy, and another new arrival causes a farming family to celebrate. Starring Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The unexplained death of a newborn baby delivered by Cynthia puts the midwife under intense scrutiny from the police and the pregnant women of Poplar, placing immense strain on her work and health as she questions her own abilities. Chummy faces pressure of a different kind as she and PC Noakes pursue a dream which could bring exciting changes for the couple, while a chance encounter returns Jimmy to Jenny's life - with surprising results. Bryony Hannah, Miranda Hart and Jessica Raine star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is seconded to a short-staffed hospital in London, but grows increasingly reluctant to carry out her duties when she finds out she is working under intimidating surgeon Mr Tracey. Back in Poplar, the midwives are introduced to newcomer Jane and outspoken twins Meg and Mave Carter. The sisters are identical in every way, except one of them is now pregnant - forcing them to come to terms with the impact a baby will have on them. Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Not fully convinced the man is innocent, Boyd tries to find the rest of the family to establish the truth, but when he does eventually track the relatives down, he realises they have a lot to hide. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The detective oversteps the mark and finds himself sent back to the Police Training College to learn some professional etiquette and save his pension. Sidekick DS Siobhan Clarke is left to investigate the murder of an art dealer, but it is not long before her boss turns up on the trail of the killer. Ken Stott stars in the crime drama, with Claire Price and Jennifer Black.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are torn between a prestigious job offer in Paris and their fashion house, and Jack creates another dilemma by asking Beatrice to marry him. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and Barbara Jefford.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers are brought in to collect rubbish due to a national strike, and CSM Chick Henwood finds his loyalties tested as his brother is one of the strikers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy and Dave plan a betting scam when the top boxer Corporal Tony Wilton is knocked out of the team, but their scheme falls apart when Wilton is recalled.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom tries to boost his reputation by undertaking a new procedure on an asthmatic patient with severe angina, but Zubin is furious he was kept in the dark about the operation. Rosie is forced to confront her true feelings for Mubbs when she discovers he has an interview at another hospital and could be leaving soon, while love is also in the air for Owen and Lisa after he invites her back to his place for a nightcap.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gary is sent on an undercover mission to ferret out information about his estranged brother Joe's criminal activities - but CID soon have reason to suspect family ties could undermine his loyalty to the force. Meanwhile, as June fights for life in hospital, Jim makes some pointed remarks to Tony that leave him in an agony of guilt and remorse.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A shadowy figure, the flash of knife - and tragedy strikes in Albert Square. An unwelcome letter causes Dot to panic, but who can she turn to for help?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dazed by the discovery of a murder on their doorstep, the inhabitants of Albert Square are interrogated by the police. Can they all account for their movements on that night?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mike learns the hospital is being sued by the son of a woman wrongly diagnosed by Daniel, while workmen in the department upset Rachel with their constant sexist comments. A vicar is admitted after an attempted suicide and it transpires a gay liberationist was threatening to reveal his sexuality. Clive Mantle and Jane Gurnett star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Madly in love with one of Lady Jane's old school friends, Lovejoy finds it hard to keep his mind on work and mistakes a set of fake watercolours for the real thing. While he's off trying to put matters right, Eric takes charge of furnishing Dalrymple's stately home - with disastrous results. Joanna Lumley guest stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Two corpses are discovered in the sea, and Jim is puzzled to learn one has only been dead a few hours, while the other drowned 40 years before. John Nettles, Cecile Paoli and Terence Alexander star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill is back at the allotment with Freddie, while Nellie has been visiting an art gallery with Derek. Shifty has a surprise for Marina.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: As Mrs Slocombe's marriage to a bouzouki-playing Greek approaches, the Grace Brothers staff plan her wedding reception.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth cannot suppress her excitement when she hears Emmet is rehearsing an amateur production of The Boyfriend, and resolves to land herself a part in the show. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: When an animal activist is killed on the first day of duck-hunting season, Mike and the team must determine whether it was an accidental shooting, or something more sinister.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of an East German immigrant, but all they have to go on are his mysterious final words, which translate as 'blue flower'. As they piece together his remarkable story, Sandra tries to gain the trust of his estranged daughter. Crime drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ageing confectionery company owner is found dead in his London hotel suite, and while Nikki tries to convince the sceptical DS Gold he was murdered, several businessmen begin to circle as it turns out the dead man was losing a desperate fight to prevent the sale of his company to investors. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves, with guest appearances by Tim Pigott-Smith, Sharon Small and Priyanga Burford.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Evie's affair with the treasury minister hits the papers, while the shop is hit badly by the opening of Maison Gilles in London. Jack is attracted to the star of his latest film.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company are put through a specialist training exercise, supervised by Veteran explosives expert, Sergeant Lewis. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave is court martialed after attacking an NCO in a jealous rage, and faces the possibility of being discharged from the army. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane visits an Army hospital to instruct its surgical team on trauma techniques, and immediately takes a shine to a captain, but is also placed in a tricky situation after witnessing a soldier being abused. Back at Holby, Mubbs inadvertently disturbs Owen and Lisa's night of passion when he calls on his boss to help with an urgent operation. The surgeon gallantly obliges, but fails to mention the fact he is drunk, risking his career in the process. Guest starring Saeed Jaffrey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fears her true identity as an undercover reporter could be blown when a journalist visits Sun Hill, while Jim decides to follow a psychic's advice and propose to June. Sheelagh is mortified to see her son arrested for a homophobic hate crime and Lance is furious at Adam for revealing he's gay, while Steve and Cameron find the dead body of a young thug - could he be the latest victim of Gabriel's vigilante campaign?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon has some important news for Phil and Grant, and wants to get to them before the police do.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Eibhlin and John take stock of recent events, Grant finds himself in a tight corner, Hattie has a visit from her teacher and Michelle receives some good news.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An accident on board a pleasure cruiser results in several people being hurt. Trevor installs a new system that exasperates the staff, while Laura and Ash argue about fund-raising initiatives and Baz tells Charlie the reason she is staying at a hotel..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Eric gets involved with an Irish rock band, while Lovejoy takes to the water with Lady Jane's friend Victoria Cavero and bravely pops the question - only to receive an unexpected response. Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Chris Jury star with guests Joanna Lumley and the members of Hothouse Flowers.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: The son of an eccentric millionaire suspects his father's housekeeper is plotting to murder the old boy for his money. Jersey-set police drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The new shop is vandalised and Billy loses a vanload of organic vegetables. Aveline has left Oswald and arrives home with baby baggage.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: When sales figures are down along with the profits, Grace Brothers is forced to lay off staff. Mr Rumbold comes up with the ingenious plan that the employees themselves must decide who is fired. Classic British comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth indulges another of her flamboyant whims and decides she and Richard need a new car - but a modest three-door hatchback is not what she had in mind. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates the meticulously planned murder of an elderly birdwatcher, and begins to suspect that he is on the trail of a vengeful serial killer. However, the case is jeopardised when he becomes too close to one of the key suspects. Drama, starring Kenneth Branagh, Sarah Smart, David Warner, Tom Hiddleston, Saskia Reeves and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In a special edition of the detective drama that features only two members of the team, Gerry Standing and Steve McAndrew travel to Glasgow, where a new Ucos section is being set up. While there, they agree to assist the investigation into the 1993 unsolved murder of James Soutar, the wealthy owner of a string of betting shops. Cathy Sinclair, one of the beneficiaries of the bookie's will at his death, had a care-home upbringing in common with Soutar, but she claims to have no idea who he was or why she was left 15,000. McAndrew has a personal stake in the case - the original investigating officer was corrupt cop Frank McNair, who had an affair with his wife, and their paths soon cross. The London-based officers' questions begin to unsettle someone and a campaign of victimisation against them begins, but it's a revelation from McAndrew's girlfriend Charley that reawakens a long-dormant scandal and clears the path to a solution. Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is baffled by the conflicting possible motives after two women are shot dead in a house basement - and the investigation isn't helped by Jack having to work alongside an old flame, the ambitious DI Chrissy Reed. Meanwhile, Leo faces a difficult choice when he is asked to prove his pathologist mentor made a mistake in a case that resulted in a mother being imprisoned for smothering her baby to death. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.desc: The sisters return to London following the success of their designs for American store Sears, only to find that business back home has suffered in their absence.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: After a mystery sea monster washes up on a UK beach, extreme angler Jeremy Wade sets off on a journey to unmask this beast and find out whether it poses any threat to humans. His journey takes him to London, where he digs for clues among celebrated naturalist Charles Darwin's historic specimens, to the frozen waters of Greenland, where he ice fishes deeper than he's ever fished before, and on to the fjords of Norway, where he attempts to reel in one of these sea monsters before an Arctic storm rolls in.

programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach.

programme.desc: Juliet serves up a selection of bakes that involve spices. She makes spiced pumpkin pie with a meringue topping, chocolate and chilli cookies and winter pavlova with spiced apples and pears. She also visits a Lebanese bakery and is joined by food and travel writer John Gregory-Smith, who makes date and cinnamon squares.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are starting to feel festive with a few winter warmers. Lisa begins with a blue cheese and butternut squash pie, followed by John's sausage casserole. They also serve a family favourite - macaroni cheese, with a twist - and for dessert it's a classic ginger cake served two ways.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by Asimakis Chaniotis, London's youngest Michelin-starred chef, to create a family feast from Greece. The menu starts with scrambled eggs for breakfast and chicken gyros for lunch. Then Asimakis rustles up his mum's meatball soup for dinner before Nadia makes Greek almond crescent biscuits for dessert.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack AP Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the pefect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the climax of the star-studded spin-off from the long-running singing contest. Over the past seven weeks, the line-up of famous faces has been whittled down to today's finalists, all under the watchful mentoring of judging panel Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh. In this grand final, they will perform to impress both the viewing public and the judges, with the most popular act being crowned as the first celebrity series champion and securing a recording contract.

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Globetrotting Emma is house hunting for love with the help of her cousin Kelly - and she has a substantial list of demands to be met as she visits three single men's homes. In the running is a rugby player, a trendy musician and a bodybuilder. Which one will she choose to go back to her house for a date?.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
programme.desc: The teenage wizard continues his search for the artefacts containing fragments of the dark lord Voldemort's soul. Time is running out, as the evil sorcerer is aware of Harry's mission, and marshals his forces for a final, devastating attack on Harry and his friends at Hogwarts school. Conclusion of the fantasy saga, with Daniel Radcliffe, Ralph Fiennes, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson and Alan Rickman.

programme.title: The ITV Election Debate
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham hosts a debate to which seven parties in the General Election campaign have been invited, ahead of the poll on December 12. The parties are the Conservatives, Labour, the Liberal Democrats, the SNP, the Brexit Party, the Greens and Plaid Cymru. Brexit is likely to be high on the agenda for this debate, along with issues including the NHS, crime, education and climate change.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston narrates a selection of clips submitted by members of the public, which display in cringe-worthy detail some of the many things that can go wrong while away on holiday. A walk in the woods becomes a fight for survival, a man from Wales becomes a shark-wrestler, and an unfortunate holiday-maker ruins all his once-in-a-lifetime holiday snaps.

programme.title: Police, Camera, Auction
programme.desc: An insight into the auctions where criminals' assets from their nefarious activities are sold at auction, with the proceeds usually going to help those whose lives have been blighted by crime. From sports cars and designer goods to outrageous bling and strange collectibles, cameras reveal the broad range of criminals' possessions seized by specialist police teams and put under the hammer.The auctioneers and police discuss their work, while those victims who will benefit from the money wait anxiously to see the outcome of the sales.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with Kev Paxton and Anthony Devine helping her transform a cooker hood, a sofa and a collection of jars.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Twenty nine-year-old twins Brandi and Kandi are close after a traumatic childhood, seeing food as a comfort. After weight-loss surgery, more challenges await the pair.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns prepare for their commitment celebration but a disastrous dress rehearsal threatens to ruin the day for Kody and his four wives.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Dress: The 12 Dresses of Christmas
programme.desc: Randy looks back at beautiful festive bridal looks, counting down his 12 favourite Christmas styles.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In the 1980s and '90s, there were around 200 murders and attacks on sex workers across the Midlands. Stafford man Alun Kyte was later found to be responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Missouri farmers Charles and Grace Lewis, who were killed in September 1993. William Rousan was later found to have masterminded their murder as part of a plot to steal their cattle, assisted by his teenage son Brent, and his brother Robert.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How investigators came to suspect that the perpetrator of a sophisticated string of Chicago bank robberies could be a policeman.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A look at the impact of Phoenix's location in the Sonoran desert, as well as how it affects the animals that live there.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to the Halls Gap Zoo in Victoria, where Stephanie the lemur is suffering with an infection in her tooth that could become a major problem if not fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.
